De la transition politique à la transition constitutionnelle : Pour une Quatrième République au Mali, à l’aune de la crise multidimensionnelle
02 Nov 2019 by bamada.net
Si le sujet des transitions constitutionnelles et politiques semble épuisé en Afrique noire francophone, l’analyse de la crise multidimensionnelle malienne révèle qu’il attise encore la réflexion des constitutionnalistes africains. Ceux-ci renouvellent en effet le débat juridico-politique sur l’interdépendance de la transition constitutionnelle et de la transition politique qui devrait conduire à l’exercice de la fonction constituante. Mais quelle acception donner à ces deux concepts si étroitement liés ? Notre contribution va s’efforcer de l’expliquer.



 


1—Le dialogue national, un élément de la transition politique


Si la transition politique s’accompagne logiquement d’une transition constitutionnelle, l’une et l’autre ont une finalité différente. C’est pourquoi l’expression « transition politique », à l’aune de la crise multidimensionnelle malienne, doit être clarifiée, car elle est source d’ambiguïtés dans le débat opposant les défenseurs de la Troisième République et les partisans de la nécessité d’une Quatrième République : c’est une simple période de normalisation du régime en question qui entraîne un nouveau régime politique.
La transition constitutionnelle, quant à elle, tend à établir une nouvelle Constitution, durable, par le recours au pouvoir constituant originaire. Il permet de corriger les limites de la Troisième République en instaurant un véritable régime parlementaire qui apparaît comme une solution souhaitable à la crise multidimensionnelle malienne. Dès lors, la transition constitutionnelle dépasse de beaucoup la seule question politique.
Cependant, la transition politique et la transition constitutionnelle auront une importance spécifique au cours de la reconstruction d’un État malien. On sait que l’adoption d’une nouvelle Constitution n’est pas suffisante pour garantir une stabilité durable, car la refondation d’un pays dépend effectivement du comportement des acteurs politiques. Cela dit, le dialogue national inclusif en cours n’est rien d’autre qu’une manifestation de la transition politique, voire une réconciliation politico-sociale.


2—La transition constitutionnelle, une porte ouverte à une Quatrième République – et à un régime parlementaire


Associer transition et consolidation ne suffit pas à reconstruire l’État au moyen du droit constitutionnel. Cette contribution veut en effet démontrer que la transition politique ne peut être la seule solution pour sortir de la crise. Cela étant, pour ce qui est des graves problèmes au Mali, nous ne sommes pas favorables à une révision totale de la Constitution, car elle pourrait conduire à une « Constitution inconstitutionnelle ».
Pour toutes ces raisons, l’idée d’une Quatrième République peut paraître chimérique, car, a priori, l’avènement d’une nouvelle République n’implique pas de facto un véritable changement dans les rapports entre les institutions. La Quatrième République règlerait cependant des imperfections afférentes à la pratique institutionnelle et aux relations entre les différents pouvoirs. La Troisième République malienne est limitée par son régime semi-présidentiel, souvent présenté comme un régime d’inspiration française, avec des caractéristiques particulières : le Président est élu au suffrage universel direct et dispose de pouvoirs importants que lui accorde la Constitution ; le gouvernement et son Premier ministre sont responsables devant l’Assemblée nationale. C’est pourquoi la présidentialisation du régime constitue selon nous une pathologie, car on a pu assister, sous la Troisième République, à une « dérive monarchique » des institutions.
De toute évidence, ce modèle français semble être difficilement transposable en Afrique noire francophone ; il convient, en effet, de refonder l’ordre juridique malien en se fondant sur la tradition et en tenant compte des effets de la mondialisation. La Troisième République n’est pas en soi immuable, même si elle a su apporter une continuité constitutionnelle pendant vingt-sept ans. Deux pistes peuvent alors être explorées pour bâtir une Quatrième République : l’instauration d’un régime strictement présidentiel, ou celle d’un régime de type parlementaire à la malienne : le Premier ministre aurait les pleins pouvoirs, tandis que le poste de président de la République serait honorifique.


 Balla CISSÉ, docteur et enseignant-chercheur en droit public à l’université Paris-13.

Split among Turkey followers .. Calls expose hidden!
02 Nov 2019 by Dubai
It seems that the deal concluded by the Turkish forces with the Russian military delegation and led to the delivery of 18 elements of the regime forces two days ago through the Darbasiyah crossing "for free", will not go unnoticed, tensions and internal divisions among the factions loyal to Turkey after the deal is still ongoing, according to The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.
In detail, the Observatory mentioned, according to confirmed information, the defection of the "Homs al-Adiya Brigade", which is part of the "Sultan al-Murad" faction, which is affiliated with the so-called "Syrian National Army", and then joined the "army of pride in Hama", due to disputes within The National Army after the deal of prisoners of the regime, which was concluded free of charge, where the breakaway faction considered the deal "betrayal".



Armed factions loyal to Turkey
the beginning..
The story began when Turkey announced that it had released days earlier the release of 18 Syrian regime soldiers it had previously detained in northeastern Syria. The Turkish Ministry of Defense confirmed on Twitter that "the 18 members of the regime who were caught during the combing and reconnaissance operations and the extension of security southeast of the city of Ras al-Ain, were returned after coordination with the Russian side."
The Syrian Observatory reported at the time that the detainees had crossed into Syrian territory through the Darbasiyah crossing, through a military delegation from the regime forces that arrived in Darbasiyah to receive the prisoners in accordance with the Russian-Turkish agreement. However, a dispute broke out with the Turkish side that did not know what it led to the regime's delegation to leave. Rossi receives the prisoners.
In turn, Turkish Defense Minister Hulusi Akar claimed that elements of the Syrian regime forces were handed over to the Russians, and that two of them received treatment in a Turkish hospital, but according to reliable sources told the "Observatory," these prisoners were not treated in accordance with the agreements and laws All of them were taken to Syria without medication or first aid, and they all arrived with blood covering their bodies and clothes all torn.



Elements of Syrian factions loyal to Turkey
"Madness"
This deal was not satisfactory to the forces of the so-called "National Army", where the Observatory talked about the possession of audio recordings showing the state of anger and resentment that prevailed among the factions of the pro-Turkey, specifically the faction of the "Free Eastern Group", especially after the bad reputation gained recently after criticism His guilt arrived to accuse his forces of war crimes and involvement in the murder of Kurdish party politician Hefreen Khalaf in a disgraceful manner.
The biggest mistake
In the same context, the Observatory received an audio recording in which an element of "Ahrar Al-Sharqiya" reports that the biggest mistake in the issue of handing over prisoners of the regime forces to the Russian military delegation for free is not on Turkey, but on what is known as the Syrian National Army and its Minister of Defense Salim. Idris, the head of their rescue government.



Members of pro-Turkish factions in northern Syria (AFP)
"What is happening is that the Turkish army is fighting a battle that has been prepared for it and is certainly preparing for what it will do in the future," the spokesman said in the recording. "So we have to ask ourselves before we are charged with" treason "to anyone: Did the national army or its defense minister talk to the Turks before We knew only one goal was that the area would be a safe area, we all expected that the Kurds and the PKK would bring the regime into the border once the battle started, but did the national army talk to Turks about the situation then if the regime forces entered? "Consider our killers numbers"
"We entered a battle in which people were killed. These are not just numbers to sacrifice at any time. Why didn't the defense minister or faction leaders talk about it? No one talked to the Turks about this. Basically the national army did not." He knows the date of the battle, how can we say something when the Turkish side decides to hand over the prisoners or stop the battle or anything? This battle has killed more than 120 of us, yet we can not blame anyone. "



Members of pro-Turkish armed factions (AFP)
The spokesman added, in the audio recording: "Blame the Minister of Defense and faction leaders who were interested in only one thing, is to deliver speeches in his fighters as a companion as a companion, all were looking for likes on social networking sites. These elements are young people have no purpose, Rather than delivering speeches, the first was to ask commanders, the defense minister and the battle partner about how to act if the Russians, Americans or the regime intervened.Z letters before the battle begins. Everyone made the same mistake. As the battle began, everyone was looking for prisoners to take selfies with them and spread them everywhere. Blame the self-appointed guardians of the people. "
"Mercenaries without rights"
In a second audio recording also obtained by the Observatory, another member of the same faction speaks not only of the issue of the extradition of prisoners, but also of accusations that pro-Turkish factions have plundered and looted the homes of citizens in areas under their control. Calling himself a "patriot" but far from patriotism, we are talking about a battle, so the defense minister should have spoken with the Turks to clarify some points, including prisoners of war who must be prisoners and the ally is not allowed to interfere with them. It is like a mercenary who is fighting only and is not entitled to talk As two types of mercenaries, a mercenary fighting for money and a mercenary fighting for theft of his family, this is the stage of despair, a mercenary whose livelihood is theft of the houses of his family which he calls spoils. The defense alone, but also the faction leaders, because instead of making points on the letters kept talking only about their potential and write reports against each other, and there are people killed from the factions against which written reports.



Members of pro-Turkish armed factions (AFP)
In the third recording, a person associated with the same faction attacks attempts to justify what happened as an "intersection of interests" with Turkey, saying: "On the issue of intersection of interests, this term is new and we created it to justify ourselves and alleviate the pain inside us. This term can only be achieved between countries that achieve their interests together commercially, politically and economically. Either a party that achieves its interests will take away my rights and land and call this an intersection of interests?
Resentment of all regions of Turkey followers
It is noteworthy that the observatory reported that the forces of the dissident faction will leave within days to join the other faction, citing a source from the region that there have been detainees for seven years when those factions have not yet been released, while the prisoners of the regime have been released in only 5 days and without any charge.
The Observatory stressed that the state of dissatisfaction was not limited to the members of the ranks of the so-called "National Army", but also extended to all areas of northern Syria under the control of factions loyal to Turkey.
